body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Support the fuel tank and remove the fuel tank support.
Lower the fuel tank into position and secure with the two fixings. Tighten to
If a bellypan is fitted, ensure that the three drain hoses protrude below the lower edge of the bellypan's side moulding, as shown below.

If the fuel tank is raised or removed, the fuel tank drain hoses will be pulled above the lower edge of the bellypan's side moulding. This may allow water and/or fuel to drain onto the painted surface of the bellypan.
To prevent paint damage, ensure the three drain hoses protrude below the lower edge of the bellypan's side moulding after the fuel tank has been lowered and secured.
Battery Reconnection and fuel tank panel
Reconnect the battery positive (red) lead first and tighten to
Refit the front panel to the fuel tank and tighten the fixings to
Securely fit the fuel tank support to its location under the seat base.

title: Fuel Tank – Lowering and Securing
